DataSource.Query: SELECT Manufacturer FROM Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer = "VMware, Inc." OR Manufacturer = "Microsoft Corporation"
SELECT Manufacturer FROM Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer <> "VMware, Inc." AND Manufacturer <> "Microsoft Corporation"

DisplayString.Name: Windows Computer Addendum
DisplayString.Description: Discovers Virtual Machine attribute for non-Hyper V hosts as well as GMT offset attribute for Windows Computer objects

DisplayString.Name: GMT Offset Discovery
DisplayString.Description: Discovers GMT Offset (in minutes) for Windows computer objects.

DisplayString.Name: Virtual Machine Discovery (True)
DisplayString.Description: Discover Virtual Machine Attribute for non-Hyper V hosts.

DisplayString.Name: Virtual Machine Discovery (False)
DisplayString.Description: Populates Virtual Machine attribute as False for non VM computer objects.

DisplayString.Name: VMWare Virtual Machine: Ballooned Memory Present
DisplayString.Description: VMWare Virtual Machine: Ballooned Memory Present

DisplayString.Name: VMWare Virtual Machine: Ballooned Memory Present
Collect Memory Shared Saved in MB
VMWare Tools Service is not running
DisplayString.Description: VMWare Tools Service is not running

DisplayString.Name: VMWare Tools Service is not Running
DisplayString.Description: Please see the alert context for details.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This management pack populates the attributes "GMT Offset In Minutes" and "Virtual Machine" for Windows Computer objects.
The GMT Offset in minutes discovery is a single discovery that runs once per day. It will calculate the *current* offset from GMT.

The Virtual Machine discovery is a two part discovery based on the value of Manufacturer in Win32_ComputerSystem. It will allow organizations using non Hyper-V hosts to identify VMs (value will be true).

maml:section.maml:title: Acknowledgements
maml:section.maml:para: The Virtual Machine Discovery is based on work by Kevin Holman and Pete Zerger.
The GMT Offset Discovery is based on work by Kevin Holman.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The GMT Offset in minutes discovery is a single discovery that runs once per day. It will calculate the *current* offset from GMT from the value of CurrentTimeZone in Win32_ComputerSystem.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery will set the Virtual Machine attribute to True based on the value of Manufacturer in Win32_ComputerSystem.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery will set the Virtual Machine attribute to False based on the value of Manufacturer in Win32_ComputerSystem.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor will detect if the VMWare Memory Ballooning is in effect. See VMWare documentation for more information about Memory Ballooning.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery checks if the Virtual Machine is hosted on a ESX machine.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor checks to see that the VMWare Tools Service is running.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the value of CPU Stolen Time for VMWare.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the value of Memory Target size for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the Limit in MHz value for the virtual machine processor.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the Active Memory in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the amount of Memory consumed by the Memory Balloon feature in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records the host processor speed in MHz for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records memory limit in MB for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records memory mapped value in MB for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records memory overhead value in MB for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records memory reservation value in MB for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare processor shares value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare processor reservation value in MHz for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare processor percent time value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Memory Used in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Memory Swapped in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Memory Shares value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Memory Shared Saved in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Memory Shared in MB value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule records VMWare Effective VM Speed in MHz value for the virtual machine.
This rule is disabled by default.
